photoexcited electrons have two kinds of transfer routes accessible between two semiconductors, i.e., S-scheme and Type-II routes.When the S-scheme route is adopted, the photoelectrons excited to CB of InVO would be transferred to VB of p-C 3 N 4 to combine with holes, leaving high-energy electrons in CB of p-C 3 N 4 participating in CO 2 RR and holes in VB of InVO 4 for water oxidation reactions.In contrast, if a type-II route is employed, photoelectrons would transfer from CB of p-C 3 N to CB of InVO 4
